column5: Guys,Just returned from our trip to Esnagami Lodge. We left yesterday morning with frozen fish, had them on ice all day/night yesterday and just arrived back in Indy. What do i do now? Can I put them in the freezer or will they get freezer burn after thawing out slightly? If not, how long will they last in the fridge before I should cook them? We just had so much Walleye i wouldn't mind waiting until next week to cook them up. Any advice is appreciated. I'll also type up a trip report later and post it.
I always put mine in ziplocks filled with water then freeze again and never had a problem...had them weeks later.
b/c they probably aren't thawed all of the way through. Are you saying the cold water acts as a protective barrier from the freezer burn/ice crystals that will form otherwise?
Indy give us the directions to your house, start the oil we'll bring the beer taters and beans!!!No more problem!!
